page.title: 08MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (7)
page.content: Scene three shows some of the famous prisoners kept in the castle during the Civil War..{Colonel John {Lilburne, Sir Hardress Waller, James {Temple, Dean Bandinel and his son {James,}who both died from injuries when they fell on the rocks in trying to escape.{William Prynne,}imprisoned 1638-40, can be seen in his own cell,with his ears cut off. The final scene shows some French aristocrats who had escaped to Jersey during the French Revolution, talking to{Admiral Philippe d'Auvergne,}who was responsible to the English Government for their welfare, as well as for the protection of the Channel Islands. After the waxworks comes the museum and then, with more steps, the battle- ments at the top of the Keep, with the Union Jack fluttering above us.
